    • Method Detail

      • hasRegisteredBehavior

        public boolean hasRegisteredBehavior()
        Description copied from interface: Behaviors
        Replies true if at least a behavior is registered.

        A registered behavior is not necessary running. It may wait for events.

        Specified by:
        hasRegisteredBehavior in interface Behaviors
        Returns:
        true if a behavior is registered; otherwise false.

      • getRegisteredBehaviors

        public Collection<Behavior> getRegisteredBehaviors()
        Description copied from interface: Behaviors
        Replies the registered behaviors.

        A registered behavior is not necessary running. It may wait for events.

        Specified by:
        getRegisteredBehaviors in interface Behaviors
        Returns:
        the unmodifiable collection of the registered behavior.

      • registerBehavior

        public Behavior registerBehavior(Behavior attitude,
                                 org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.lib.Functions.Function1<? super Event,? extends Boolean> filter)
        Description copied from interface: Behaviors
        Register a Behavior for the owner agent. The new Behavior will react to all declared events received by the agent.

        If the filter is provided, it will be used for determining if the given behavior accepts a specific event. If the filter function replies true for a specific event as argument, the event is fired in the behavior context. If the filter function replies false, the event is not fired in the behavior context.

        Specified by:
        registerBehavior in interface Behaviors
        Parameters:
        attitude - the behavior to add to the agent.
        filter - the filter that enables to indicates if an event is accepted by a behavior.
        Returns:
        the given behavior.

      • unregisterBehavior

        public Behavior unregisterBehavior(Behavior attitude)
        Description copied from interface: Behaviors
        Unregisters a behavior for the owner agent.
        Specified by:
        unregisterBehavior in interface Behaviors
        Parameters:
        attitude - the behavior to remove to the agent.
        Returns:
        the given behavior.

      • wake

        public void wake(Event event,
                 Scope<Address> scope)
        Description copied from interface: Behaviors
        Wake the agent's behaviors reacting to the Event evt.

        Note that the scope parameter could be used only for filtering the agents (the current agent and its sub-agents) in order to determine the ones that will receive the event. The behaviors of the current agent (registered with Behaviors.registerBehavior(Behavior) will always receive the event if the current agent is not discarded. Indeed, because the behaviors have no associated address, they cannot be filtered individually.

        Specified by:
        wake in interface Behaviors
        Parameters:
        event - the event to emit to the agent's behaviors and in the internal context.
        scope - the definition of the scope that will be used for selected the receivers of the events.

      • asEventListener

        public EventListener asEventListener()
        Description copied from interface: Behaviors
        Replies the interface to dispatch an event to agent's Behaviors.
        Specified by:
        asEventListener in interface Behaviors
        Returns:
        the event listener.

        public Behavior registerBehavior(Behavior attitude)
        Description copied from interface: Behaviors
        Register a Behavior for the owner agent. The new Behavior will react to all declared events received by the agent.

        If the filter is provided, it will be used for determining if the given behavior accepts a specific event. If the filter function replies true for a specific event as argument, the event is fired in the behavior context. If the filter function replies false, the event is not fired in the behavior context.

        Specified by:
        registerBehavior in interface Behaviors
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the given behavior.

        Wake the agent's behaviors reacting to the Event evt.

        Note that the scope parameter could be used only for filtering the agents (the current agent and its sub-agents) in order to determine the ones that will receive the event. The behaviors of the current agent (registered with Behaviors.registerBehavior(Behavior) will always receive the event if the current agent is not discarded. Indeed, because the behaviors have no associated address, they cannot be filtered individually.
